text.p: Barringer Laboratories Inc said on Friday it expects overall sales for 1997 to exceed those of 1996.
Barringer in a news release reported a second quarter loss of $79,000, or $0.05 per share, on revenues of $1.8 million.
For the same period a year ago, the company had a profit of $164,000, or $0.10 per share, on revenues of $1.7 million.
For the first half of 1997, Barringer's revenues were $3.3 million, compared to $3.0 million a year ago, and the company said it expects to finish the year with levels higher than full-year 1996.
Barringer had a loss of $252,000, or $0.16 per share, for the first six months of 1997. For the same period a year ago it had a profit of $78,000, or $0.05 per share.
